title: 111_hr563
content: The "SCHIP Expansion for Kids in Need Act of 2009" requires priority for SCHIP coverage of children in families with income under 200 percent of the federal poverty level. The "SCHIP Expansion for Kids in Need Act of 2009" prioritizes SCHIP coverage for children in families with income under 200 percent of the federal poverty level. Section 2108 of the Social Security Act is amended to include income-related data in annual reports on the success of states in providing health insurance coverage for children at various income levels. Regulations will be established for data collection and statistical methodologies by September 30, 2009. The Secretary will establish standards for data collection and statistical methodologies by September 30, 2009, for reporting family income levels based on gross income relative to percentages of the poverty line. Additionally, no State child health plan will be approved unless a plan for coverage of low-income children is developed and submitted. No State child health plan can be approved under section 2106 for fiscal year 2010 onwards unless the State develops and submits a plan to ensure coverage for all qualified low-income children, gets approval for the plan, and implements it. The Secretary will promptly review and approve submitted plans. The Secretary will review and approve State child health plans for fiscal year 2010 to ensure coverage for low-income children. Plans will be approved if reasonably designed, with an opportunity for resubmission if disapproved. Notification will be provided promptly. The Secretary will review and approve State child health plans for fiscal year 2010, providing an opportunity for resubmission if disapproved. Notification of approval or disapproval will be prompt. The term 'qualified low-income child' is defined as a child whose family gross income does not exceed 200 percent of the poverty line for the family size and meets all eligibility requirements except income-related ones. The amendment limits the use of SCHIP funds based on increases in income eligibility levels for State child health plans. Payment will not be made for individuals whose family income exceeds the new eligibility level set by the State. The amendment restricts SCHIP funds based on income eligibility levels for State child health plans. Payment will not be made for individuals whose family income exceeds the State's eligibility level unless the State proves that no more than 10% of low-income children are not covered. The amendment limits SCHIP funds based on income eligibility levels for State child health plans. Payment will not be restricted for qualified low-income children or currently eligible children.
